content:
Hi there

When the example page in build process is generated by narrative generator (i.e. automatically), I found the link on the display page sometimes cannot link to the right place , but the link in xml page is correct.

For example,
http://build.fhir.org/provenance_biocompute_object_example.html
The link to practitioner will redefine to a 404 error page
However when you check and click link in this xml file
http://build.fhir.org/provenance_biocompute_object_example.xml.html
This is a good pointer.

Can somebody tell me how this happens or how to avoid this problem?
can you make a task for that?
I see... What's the meaning of making a task?
Is that means the task of change in the code to point to the correct location mapped by id not just concacenat the string in xml file?
Sorry about that , I thought this is called tracker.
sure. items are called tasks. don't worry about it
#12451 is submitted. Sorry I cannot find my name in real submitter so I use my colleagues' instead

@yiwang Don't worry about your name not being in the list. Maintaining that list of names is a manual process. When you submit a task and leave the name blank, we create an entry for you. (We need to do it because of a weird quirk in how gForge supports (or rather doesn't support) searching by submitter.

Thanks Lloyd.
In that case can I be added to the real submitter list?
@Grahame Grieve Hi, when will this bug be expected to fix in your workflow?
I want to check all the link and make sure they will point to the right place.
not sure. probably between Xmas and New year
Thanks for letting me know about that.
